decision_conditions: All new external finishes shall be carried out in materials to match those of the existing building(s) to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area, and in order that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

Before the garage conversion hereby permitted is first occupied/used, the area set aside for car parking shall be laid out and surfaced with materials that would drain naturally within the site to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority, as shown on drawing No.0005 which was received on the 05th November 2019 and retained permanently thereafter for the accommodation of vehicles visiting the site and shall not be used for any other purpose.

To ensure that car parking accommodation is made permanently available to the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority in the interest of highway safety, and that the development accords with the Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC33.

Clear and unobstructed visibility sight lines shall be provided to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority in the position and for the distance shown on the approved plan. The approved sight lines shall be kept permanently unobstructed thereafter to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:-   In the interests of highway safety.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).

The Local Planning Authority consider it essential that the whole of the development is carried out and that no departure whatsoever is made from the details approved, since the development would not necessarily be acceptable if partly carried out or carried out differently in any degree from the details submitted.  Also, in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2018, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with Mrs Raye (applicant) by phone and e-mail. The revisions involved clarification of the site and provision of on-site parking. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 04/11/19 & 12/11/19.
description: Retrospective permission for removal of condition 3 from P1664.01 - garage conversion
